data.title: DEVILMAN crybaby Soundtrack Getting Vinyl Release
data.meta_description: After Anime Limited revealed it's bringing DEVILMAN crybaby to Blu-ray, Milan Records said that the soundtrack is getting a vinyl release.
data.text:
Less than a week after Anime Limited revealed it is bringing DEVILMAN crybaby to Blu-ray for both North America and the United Kingdom, Milan Records disclosed that it’s giving Kensuke Ushio’s soundtrack a vinyl release.

DEVILMAN crybaby Vinyl Packaging

Here is the tracklisting:

DISC 1 – SIDE A

The Genesis

D.V.M.N. (Theme from “DEVILMAN crybaby”)

Buddy, Ryo

Devilman No Uta

Strategist

Akira the Wild

Night Ride

Miki

Miki the Witch

DISC 1 – SIDE B

Wired

School Life

Wishy Washy

They Said…

Cheesy Drop

Panic

Possession

Dreadful Stories

Who Is She?

Behind the Scene

Sabbath I

DISC 2 – SIDE A

Judgement

Smells Blood

Death Mask

Anxiety

60311

The Crawling

Nightmare

His Heart

Tears

The Two of Them

Night Hawk

Beautiful Silene

Black Mist

DISC 2 – SIDE B

Crisis

The Cult

Enigma

Prayer

Her Baton

Veritas

Ryo

Satan

Pathetique

From Here to Eternity

Crybaby

You can preorder it here if you’re interested. Its release date has not yet been revealed.

DEVILMAN crybaby, which previously nabbed Anime of the Year at the Crunchyroll Anime Awards, comes to us from director Masaaki Yuasa and Science SARU. It launched in 2018 and is currently streaming on Netflix. The franchise started with the manga Devilman by Go Nagai, which is published as a Classic Collection by Seven Seas Entertainment. Seven Seas gave this description for it:

Go Nagai’s groundbreaking horror classic that inspired the genre for decades.

Hordes of demons, once thought entombed forever in the underworld, have now returned to Earth. Evil and corruption begin to seep into our world, as demons seize human hosts. Mankind’s only hope for salvation is to use the demons’ power against them–and only a pure-hearted man like Fudo Akira can do so without losing his humanity. Once little more than a crybaby, Akira now wields the terrible power of a devil, yet holds the innocent soul of a man–Devilman!

Source: Press release

____
